intro: Cheynia pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful cheynia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Cheynia pulchella is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
